title: MSG Entertainment Shares Down 11%; Sphere Selling 5.25M Shares
author: Josh Beckerman
excerpt: By Josh Beckerman Madison Square Garden Entertainment shares were down 11%, to $35.35, Wednesday after the company said Tuesday that Sphere Entertainment...
summary:
Madison Square Garden Entertainment shares were down 11%, to $35.35, Wednesday after the company said Tuesday that Sphere Entertainment Group LLC is selling 5.25 million shares.

In April, the company then called Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp. changed its name to Sphere Entertainment Co. and spun off its traditional live-entertainment businesses into a new company called Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp.

MSG Entertainment said that under its existing $250 million share-repurchase authorization, it plans to buy about $25 million of stock from the seller.

author: Adam Eckert
excerpt: Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp (NYSE: MSGE) shares are trading lower Wednesday after the company announced a secondary offering
summary:
Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp MSGE shares are trading lower Wednesday after the company announced a secondary offering.

What Happened: After the close on Tuesday, MSG Entertainment announced that Sphere Entertainment Group commenced an underwritten secondary offering of 5.25 million shares of MSGE common stock.

Sphere Entertainment intends to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 787,500 shares at the offering price.

MSG Entertainment said it intends to repurchase approximately $25 million worth of its shares directly from the selling stockholder.

Analyst Arren Cyganovich lowered his price target on American Express stock (ticker: AXP) to $148 from $150 on Thursday, which implies a loss of 14% from the current level. He continues to rate the shares at Sell.

Cyganovich wrote that recent Citi research on credit-card purchase data showed a slowdown in travel and entertainment spending in the second quarter.

title: EA Announces Split into Two Organizations: EA Entertainment and EA Sports
author: Technology
excerpt: Title: EA Announces Major Organizational Changes and Leadership Reshuffle Introduction: Electronic Arts (EA), one of the leading gaming companies, has recently made significant organizational changes and a reshuffle in its leadership team. The CEO, Andrew Wilson, announced the merger of studios into two separate organizations, EA Entertainment and EA Sports. This move aims to provide […]
summary:
Title: EA Announces Major Organizational Changes and Leadership Reshuffle

Electronic Arts (EA), one of the leading gaming companies, has recently made significant organizational changes and a reshuffle in its leadership team. The CEO, Andrew Wilson, announced the merger of studios into two separate organizations, EA Entertainment and EA Sports. This move aims to provide each division with more autonomy and decision-making power. Additionally, Laura Miele, the former Chief Operating Officer (COO), has transitioned to the role of President of Entertainment, Technology, and Central Development, overseeing various non-sports studios.

HB Entertainment

On June 18, the 
Seoul Central District Court
's Civil Agreement Division 63, led by Chief Judge Park Chan Seok, dismissed Goo Hye Sun's claim for damages against HB Entertainment, ruling against the plaintiff.


Goo Hye Sun and HB Entertainment had entered into an exclusive contract in 2018, envisioning a strong partnership as a joint agency for the couple, including her husband, actor 
Ahn Jae Hyun
, who was also represented by HB Entertainment at the time.
